alert.note: Alert for Fayette (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 15 at 7:10AM EDT until August 15 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Fayette County in southeastern West Virginia... * Until 1100 AM EDT. * At 710 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 5 inches of rain have fallen and flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Montgomery, Ansted, Smithers, Gauley Bridge, Hawks Nest State Park and Powellton. Local law enforcement has reported high water across multiple roadways in the warned area, with several water rescues underway. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
